root.name: push()
root.description: Pushes the current transformation matrix onto the matrix stack. Understanding push() and pop() requires understanding the concept of a matrix stack. The push() function saves the current coordinate system to the stack and pop() restores the prior coordinate system. push() and pop() are used in conjuction with the other transformation methods and may be embedded to control the scope of the transformations.
root.related: pop() translate() rotate() rotateX() rotateY() rotateZ()
